00011 
00012 
00014 //
00015 // GFrameHandler is a tiny C++ library for some basic manipulations
00016 // in cycle loop and frame time of game. It could be easily used to
00017 // limit frame rate of an application or getting frame time for time
00018 // based game.
00019 //
00020 // Email        : chinfoo@galaxist.net
00021 // Website      : http://www.galaxist.net
00022 //
00023 //
00024 //
00025 // Special Thanks to Lf3T-Hn4D ( http://lefthand.xullum.net ) for
00026 // making this tiny library better.
00027 //
00029 
00030 
00031 
00032 #ifndef GFRAMEHANDLER_H
00033 #define GFRAMEHANDLER_H
00034 
00035 
00036 class GFrameHandler
00037 {
00038 
00039 private:
00040         int frame_count;
00041         int last_fps_time;
00042         int previous_time;
00043         int elapsed_time;
00044         int fps;
00045         int tpf_limit;
00046         int tpf;
00047 
00048 
00049 public:
00050         GFrameHandler();
00051 
00052         /*
00053         Reset all stored variables. If GFrameHandler is instantiated much earlier
00054         before main loop, call this function right before main loop.
00055         */
00056         void reset(void);
00057 
00058         /*
00059         Set maximum FPS( frames per second) limit.
00060         */
00061         void set_fps_limit(int fps);
00062 
00063         /*
00064         Set the maximum TPF( time per frame ) limit. This is basically same with
00065         set_fps_limit(int) but with better better control. FPS  = 1/TPF(in second).
00066         */
00067         void set_tpf_limit(int millisecond);
00068 
00069         /*
00070         Call this function in each cycle to limit the frame time. The default frame
00071         time limit is 20 millisecond, use set_fps_limit(int) or set_tpf_limit(int)
00072         for different frame rate locking. *Highly recommended to have this function
00073         call right before calculate().
00074         */
00075         void limit_frame(void);
00076 
00077         /*
00078         This has the same functionality with limit_fps() but could release slightly
00079         more CPU time when it is possible, the trade off is lower accuracy. *Highly
00080         recommended to have this function call right before calculate().
00081         */
00082         void limit_frame_fast(void);
00083 
00084         /*
00085         Calculate current FPS and frame time. It is recommended to call this member
00086         function at the end at the cycle.
00087         */
00088         void calculate(void);
00089 
00090         /*
00091         Get current  FPS.
00092         */
00093         int get_fps(void) const;
00094 
00095         /*
00096         Get elapsed time since previous frame ( current frame time ) in millisecond.
00097         */
00098         int get_elapsed_time(void) const;
00099 
00100 };
00101 
00102 
00103 #endif
